Instructions



This assignment is due before class on Monday, Oct. 16. Submit a Jupyter notebook to Canvas. Copy each question into a Markdown cell and perform the analysis in the following cell(s).



Suppose you want to have $10,000 in 5 years. If the annual interest rate is 6%, how much should you invest today to reach that goal?
You plan to invest $5,000 in a savings account that offers an annual interest rate of 4%. How much will your investment be worth in 10 years?
You want to save for your child’s college education, which will cost $50,000 per year for four years starting in 5 years. If you can earn an annual interest rate of 8%, how much should you invest today to cover all four years’ expenses?
You plan to deposit $2,000 at the end of each year into a retirement account that offers an annual interest rate of 7%. How much will be in your account after 10 years?
You take out a $20,000 car loan at an annual interest rate of 5% for 5 years. Calculate your monthly payment.
After making payments on your car loan for 3 years, what is the remaining balance on the loan prior to the 37th payment?
Compare two mortgage options:
A. $300,000 loan at 4.5% for 30 years.
B. $300,000 loan at 5% for 25 years.

Which option has a lower monthly payment, and which one has a lower total interest cost over the life of the loan?

You want to retire in 30 years with $1,000,000 in your retirement account. If your investments yield an annual return of 8% and you currently have no savings, how much should you save each year to reach your retirement goal? Assume the savings are at the end of each year as we did in class.

Instructions



This assignment is due before class on Monday, Oct. 23. Submit a Jupyter notebook to Canvas. Copy each question into a Markdown cell and perform the analysis in the following cell(s).



You want to retire in 30 years with $4,000,000 in your retirement account. If your investments yield an annual return of 8% and you currently have no savings, how much should you save each year to reach your retirement goal?

Suppose in #1 that your returns are normally distributed with a mean of 8% and a standard deviation of 15%. Suppose you save the amount you calculated in #1. Run a simulation to determine the probability that you will meet your retirement goal.
Repeat #2 assuming the standard deviation is only 10%. What is the probability of meeting your retirement goal?
Use the following code to calculate daily SPY returns. Calculate the skewness and kurtosis of the returns using the formulas presented in class.

import yfinance as yf
price = yf.download("spy", start="1990-01-01")["Adj Close"]
ret = price.pct_change()

Use the following code to calculate annual SPY returns. Calculate the skewness and kurtosis of the returns using the formulas presented in class.

import yfinance as yf
price = yf.download("spy", start="1990-01-01")["Adj Close"]
price = price.resample("Y").last()
ret = price.pct_change()[:-1]

Download the CPI from FRED and calculate annual inflation rates as the percent change in the end-of-year CPI from one year to the next. Using the annual (nominal) returns from #5, calculate the real rate of return of SPY each year.
The assignment is to calculate the NPV and IRR of the Sneaker Project. Do not do the Persistence part of the case. Submit an Excel workbook on Canvas before class on Monday, Oct. 30.

Submit a Jupyter notebook or an Excel workbook that does the following: Using the income statements and balance sheets for CVX and COP for the past five years and the variables Net Income, Total Revenue, Total Assets, and Stockholders Equity, calculate and plot the four financial ratios (ROE, Net Profit Margin, Asset Turnover, and Equity Multiplier) over time. Generate four figures. Each figure should show the history of one ratio for both CVX and COP. Use average balance sheet items (average the beginning-of-year and end-of-year data).
